page.title: 12The Gas Line
page.content:
Running west-east through the block is a major gas supply pipe. For most of its length it is buried below the fields. It crosses the Great Ouse above ground on its own bridge of steel girders.
The pipe is part of the national grid of high-pressure gas drawn from North Sea platform rigs. It is currently being enlarged, and the above-ground sections are thoroughly painted and inspected annually.
Despite the proximity of the pipe to the village, there is no gas supply available to any of the villagers. It seems that a small plant to convert it to normal pressure would not be economic.
